newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: S.Korean won ends lower on rumoured interventions.
newsitem.headline: S.Korean won ends lower on rumoured interventions.

text.p: The won closed weaker versus the dollar on Monday as the central bank of Korea was rumoured to have intervened in the interbank market, dealers said.
The bank, following routine, declined to confirm the action.
The local unit closed at 891.70 against Friday's closing of 890.90. It moved in a range of 890.50 to 892.00.
Dealers said the bank was rumoured to have bought dollars at around 890.60 won in late morning and again at 891.10 in the afternoon.
The central bank was also suspected of having purchased dollars in three-month forward trading, they said.
The won, otherwise, would have been strong on expected month-end export negotiations, traders said.
"The dollar was expected to remain flat at the 890 level today. However, the intervention rumours took the dollar higher than expected," said one local dealer.
Dealers saw the base mid-rate at 891.30 for Tuesday against 891.00 for Monday.
